alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 10:58AM PST until January 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed areas. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades. This includes Highway 138 near Diamond Lake, Highway 230 and portions of Highway 62. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Very low visibilities may occur as snowfall rates peak Saturday night into early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may reach 1 inch per hour at times, especially from midnight through early Sunday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
